name: Saint Martin (French part)
description: Saint Martin, officially Saint Martin (French part), is an overseas collectivity of France located in the Caribbean. It’s a dual-nation island, shared between France and the Netherlands, boasting a unique blend of European and Caribbean cultures. The island is renowned for its stunning beaches, vibrant nightlife, duty-free shopping, and diverse natural beauty, ranging from lush rainforests to dramatic cliffs and coral reefs.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The population of Saint Martin is a mix of French and Caribbean residents.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population identifies as having Caribbean heritage, with a significant French influence.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: The island's area is relatively small, making it easy to explore.
quickFacts.detail: It’s one of the smallest territories of France.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency is the Euro.
quickFacts.detail: However, US dollars are widely accepted, especially in the Dutch side.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: French is the official language, while Dutch is also spoken on the Dutch side.
quickFacts.detail: English is spoken in tourist areas.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: Saint Martin has a robust tourism-based economy.
quickFacts.detail: Tourism contributes significantly to the island's economic stability.

climateData.title: Tropical Marine Climate
climateData.description: Saint Martin enjoys a tropical marine climate characterized by warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is relatively consistent, with distinct wet and dry seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer is hot and humid, with average temperatures around 28-32°C (82-90°F). Rainfall is moderate, often occurring in the evenings.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a slight decrease in temperature and humidity. Rainfall increases, but the weather remains generally pleasant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coolest and driest season, with average temperatures around 24-27°C (75-81°F).  Sunshine is abundant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a gradual increase in temperature and humidity, with blooming flowers and lush greenery.

naturalWonders.name: Grand Case Bay
naturalWonders.description: Grand Case Bay is renowned for its pristine white sand beaches, crystal-clear turquoise waters, and vibrant beachfront restaurants. It’s a popular spot for swimming, sunbathing, and enjoying the Caribbean lifestyle.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The bay is sheltered by a coral reef, creating calm waters ideal for snorkeling and diving. The area is also famous for its 'culinary highway,' offering a diverse range of Caribbean cuisine.
viewingTips: Arrive early to secure a good spot on the beach
Try the local seafood at one of the beachfront restaurants

naturalWonders.name: Colombier-Plage
naturalWonders.description: Colombier-Plage is a dramatic coastal area featuring towering limestone cliffs, hidden coves, and stunning ocean views. It’s a haven for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The cliffs are formed from ancient coral reefs and offer a unique geological landscape. The area is also home to a diverse range of plant and animal life, including several endemic species.

naturalWonders.name: Loterie Farm
naturalWonders.description: Loterie Farm is a vast, privately-owned rainforest reserve that offers a glimpse into the island’s rich biodiversity. It’s a popular destination for hiking, birdwatching, and nature tours.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The farm is home to a wide variety of plant and animal species, including several endangered species. It’s also a significant area for research and conservation.
viewingTips: Hire a local guide for a more informative experience

biodiversityCategory.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategory.description: Saint Martin’s marine environment is incredibly diverse, boasting vibrant coral reefs, abundant fish populations, and a variety of marine mammals and seabirds.

statistics.details: The reefs support a wide range of coral species, including elkhorn and staghorn corals.
The waters are home to over 250 species of fish, including parrotfish, snapper, and grouper.

notableSpecies.name: Humpback Whale
notableSpecies.significance: Migrates to Saint Martin’s waters to breed and calve during the winter months.

notableSpecies.name: Loggerhead Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: Nests on the beaches of Saint Martin.

ecosystemData.title: Coastal Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Saint Martin’s coastal ecosystems are a complex mosaic of beaches, coral reefs, mangroves, and seagrass beds, providing vital habitat for a wide range of marine and terrestrial species.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: As described above, this category encompasses the diverse marine life found in Saint Martin’s waters.

biodiversityCategories.name: Mangrove Ecosystems
biodiversityCategories.description: Mangrove forests line the sheltered bays and estuaries of Saint Martin, providing crucial nursery grounds for fish and other marine species.

statistics.details: These are vital for coastal protection.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities
activities.description: Saint Martin offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all interests and skill levels.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the island’s diverse landscapes on foot, from rainforest trails to coastal cliffs.

activities.name: Loterie Farm Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail through the heart of Loterie Farm’s rainforest.

activities.name: Colombier-Plage Cliff Walk
activities.description: A challenging hike along the dramatic cliffs of Colombier-Plage.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Saint Martin’s crystal-clear waters.

activities.name: Snorkeling
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life.

activities.name: Scuba Diving
activities.description: Discover the underwater wonders of Saint Martin’s reefs.

clothing.yearRound: Comfortable walking shoes, sunglasses, insect repellent
